items.name: Strong mature cheddar
items.shortDescription: Because I love cheese
items.longDescription: All gift of cheddar cheese is welcome. No cheddar is too strong. Much more of a fan of cheddar than, say, fancy french cheeses

items.name: Poang chair
items.shortDescription: These are my favourite design of chairs. I love sitting in them.
items.longDescription: I have one, and want more. Ideally for every floor in the house. I don't care about colour etc - second hand is great.

items.name: Moorland Grit guidebook
items.shortDescription: A climbing guidebook that I won't use
items.longDescription: I don't think I will climb anything in it, but it's a guidebook of esoteric underclimbed, pieces of rock round Glossop. Rock probably best looked at rather than climbed, which is what makes the guidebook likely more fun than climbing them.

items.name: Chainsaw cutting course
items.shortDescription: Because I'd like to learn to chop wood effectively
items.longDescription: But I'd also like to keep all my fingers, and most of my face, so probs ideal to do it safeishly.

items.name: Stick (MMA) welding course
items.shortDescription: Because I've never tried welding
items.longDescription: It could be fun to know how to stick bits of metal together. It might become - to some degree - like learning to "paint" in metal.

items.name: Kayak Rolling Course
items.shortDescription: 90-minute session to develop whitewater kayak roll technique
items.longDescription: A private session in a heated pool with an instructor to develop and improve kayak rolling technique. This fundamental skill would help me be more confident in whitewater. Sessions are 90 minutes long and include instruction and boat use if needed.

items.name: 170W ThinkPad Chargers
items.shortDescription: Must be 170W - less powerful chargers won't work on my laptop
items.longDescription: Rectangle-ended tip suitable for P50/P52 etc - second hand recommended. The link has many suitable ones that would all work.

items.name: Wetsuit
items.shortDescription: Large size - 3mm or 5mm
items.longDescription: My wetsuit is about 25 years old, and is somewhat held together with prayers and luck. The one link is suggested - but any full arm, and full leg - Large size - wetsuit would be welcome. Preloved is encouraged.

items.name: USB-C to USB-A cables
items.shortDescription: I need about 6 more
items.longDescription: Second hand/preloved welcome!

items.name: 4TB 2.5" Internal Hard Drive
items.shortDescription: I'd like to be able to hold more photos in my laptop
items.longDescription: I have a 2TB HDD, and a 4TB disk would let me do more work and hold more photos of James! The one linked will fit my laptop.

items.name: Basic headphones
items.shortDescription: I can never have enough 3.5mm headphones with microphones.
items.longDescription: Please not bluetooth ones. The ones linked are my favourite model, but all headphones gratefully recieved.

items.name: Laser Printer
items.shortDescription: A used laser printer to replace our ink-drinking inkjet
items.longDescription: Our current inkjet printer drinks ink like there's no tomorrow and produces poor quality prints. A used laser printer (Samsung, Xerox, or similar) would be much more reliable and cost-effective. Color would be nice but monochrome is fine too. Used and in working condition is preferred.

items.name: 3m of tubular climbing webbing tape
items.longDescription: I lost the 3m tape from my kayaking rescue kit
items.shortDescription: 3m of this tubular webbing from this climbing shop would be a great replacement.

items.name: Whetman HMS screwgate carabiner
items.shortDescription: I lost the kayaking-spec carabinerfrom my kayaking rescue kit
items.longDescription: I used to use DMM Boa carabiners, but they broke repeatedly, and DMM told me they didn't like water. This is a water-friendly version of the DMM Boa carabiner, and is ideal for kayaking.

items.name: Technical Gore-tex waterproof jacket
items.shortDescription: To keep me warm and dry in the rain.
items.longDescription: I have an old goretex ME jacket, but it's starting to become a bit like swiss cheese - something not known for waterproofness. I've put a link to a ME Pro Shell in Large - but there are many other suitable jackets.

items.name: Wild Spirit by Helen Lloyd
items.shortDescription: My friend wrote this book and I'd love to read it.
items.longDescription: Unsolicited book recommendation: her other books are fantastic. Sadly I already own them.

items.name: AI credits
items.shortDescription: Credits for Claude AI - which I use daily
items.longDescription: I find myself finding Anthropic's Claude API extremely helpful and taking up some of my money. It helps me do things faster, better than ever before and I'm finding it extremely helpful. I sometimes spend about $2 per day on it, and it easily is delivering Â£10 of value to me each time. Money towards it would be warmly welcomed.

items.name: Babysitting
items.shortDescription: Time to help look after James - even 30 minutes makes a difference
items.longDescription: Having someone watch James, even for a short while, gives us a chance to do essential tasks or have a brief rest. This gift of time is incredibly valuable to us. No special skills needed - just patience and enthusiasm!

items.name: Sentimental items
items.shortDescription: Photos or mementos of times we've shared together
items.longDescription: I'd love photos of us doing things together, or items that help us remember shared experiences. Could be recent or from years ago - anything that might remind me of shared memories.

items.name: Chopped Firewood
items.shortDescription: We have a small stove
items.longDescription: As much as I'd love some massive pieces of tree, without a chainsaw and appropriate knowledge, any firewood would be best in stove size portions.

items.name: A stress-free Christmas
items.shortDescription: Would be dreamy
items.longDescription: We all can try

items.name: Kitchen Knives set
items.shortDescription: For cutting things without fear of bluntness
items.longDescription: Currently using knives that are too blunt to be safe. A decent set of kitchen knives would be very welcome. Second hand welcome if sharp!

items.name: Tire compressor
items.shortDescription: For pumping up flat tires
items.longDescription: I thought I had one, but I seem to have lost it. Preloved or reloved or whatever is welcome. Should work on 12v.

items.name: Mercedes Sprinter Tow Loop
items.shortDescription: For when I need a tow
items.longDescription: A towing eye that screws into the front of the van. Better to have it and not need it than need it and not have it!

items.name: Allen Key Set
items.shortDescription: From very small to quite large sizes
items.longDescription: Need a comprehensive set for furniture assembly, bike maintenance, and general fiddly things. Metric and imperial welcome. Looking for a range from tiny (1.5mm) up to larger sizes (10mm+). Second hand welcome!

items.name: Lidl or Aldi Penne
items.shortDescription: The cheap pasta that just hits different
items.longDescription: Yes, this is partly a joke gift. But also, there's something about the cheap Lidl/Aldi penne that just works better than fancy pasta. I will genuinely eat and enjoy this. Multiple bags welcome!

notes.bookNote: Currently have plenty of books - prefer other gifts unless specifically listed
